item.title: 特朗普对中国的贸易攻势触及公海
item.description: 白宫推动遏制中国的海上主导地位并对关键航道施加更大影响的势头似乎正在增强。【原文：A White House push to curb China’s maritime dominance and exert more influence over critical shipping lanes looks to be gaining momentum.】

item.title: 将工具制造商伊斯卡出售给巴菲特的史蒂夫-韦特海默逝世，享年 98 岁
item.description: 斯蒂夫-韦特海默（Stef Wertheimer）去世了，他是以色列工业家和共存倡导者，曾以 60 亿美元的价格将自己在破旧棚屋中创建的金属切削工具公司卖给了沃伦-巴菲特。享年 98 岁。【原文：Stef Wertheimer, an Israeli industrialist and coexistence advocate who sold the metal-cutting tool company that he founded in a rundown shack to Warren Buffett for $6 billion, has died. He was 98.】

item.title: 土耳其期待奇瑞签署价值 10 亿美元的电动汽车工厂协议
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，土耳其希望中国汽车制造商奇瑞汽车股份有限公司（Chery Automobile Co. Ltd.）投资约 10 亿美元建设一家电动汽车工厂，此举将增强安卡拉成为地区制造中心的雄心。【原文：Turkey expects Chinese carmaker Chery Automobile Co Ltd. to invest about $1 billion in an electric vehicle plant, a move that would bolster Ankara’s ambitions to become a regional manufacturing hub, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 丹麦债券在集中发行后将提高流动性
item.description: 丹麦的 AAA 级政府债券市场将获得急需的流动性刺激，因为中央银行将接管这个北欧国家市政当局的融资。【原文：Denmark’s AAA rated government bond market is set to get a much-needed boost to liquidity as the central bank takes over financing for the Nordic country’s municipalities.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚在大选前第二次开拓国外市场
item.description: 在总统选举前的政治动荡中，罗马尼亚今年第二次发行国际债券，以帮助弥补预算赤字。【原文：Romania is offering international bonds for the second time this year to help finance its budget deficit amid political turmoil before the presidential election.】

item.title: 俄罗斯爆炸物生产商利用化肥企业抵御制裁
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的文件，俄罗斯计划从基本逃脱了国际制裁的化肥公司订购炸药制造所需的化学成分。【原文：Russia is scheduled to receive deliveries of chemical ingredients critical to the manufacture of explosives, ordered from fertilizer companies that have largely escaped international sanctions, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 亚马逊股价低于苹果和沃尔玛，吸引力与日俱增
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的股票开始看起来像便宜货，而这个词很少被用来形容这只股票。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. shares are starting to look like a bargain, a word that has rarely been used to describe the stock.】

item.title: 淘金热是美国巨额贸易赤字的根源
item.description: 我是文斯-高勒，驻华盛顿的编辑。今天我们将探讨黄金进口对美国货物贸易逆差的推动作用。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Vince Golle, an editor in Washington. Today we’re looking at gold imports driving the US goods-trade deficit. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 肯尼亚因收入低于目标而放弃平衡预算的梦想
item.description: 肯尼亚将不得不继续借贷来为预算提供资金，放弃了到 2027 年实现支出与税收相匹配的计划。【原文：Kenya will have to keep borrowing to fund its budget, dumping plans to match its spending with collected revenue by 2027.】

item.title: 德国初创企业因特朗普的科技 "热情 "而分裂的内幕
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，Christina Kyriasoglou 在柏林揭示了德国初创企业界对唐纳德-特朗普的科技热情的激烈分歧。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Christina Kyriasoglou, in Berlin, unearths a bitter divide in Germany’s startup scene over Donald Trump’s tech enthusiasm.】

item.title: 挪威减息计划受挫于通货膨胀
item.description: 受通胀回升的影响，挪威央行本周可能将暂缓实施五年来的首次借贷成本下调。【原文：Norway’s central bank will probably hold off on delivering its first cut in borrowing costs for five years this week, thwarted by resurgent inflation.】

item.title: 贝莱德将私人信贷和股票基金纳入模型投资组合
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）刚刚完成 280 亿美元的交易狂潮，转型成为另类资产领域的主要参与者，该公司正在将复杂的私人投资整合到其为个人提供的现成投资组合中。【原文：BlackRock Inc., fresh off a $28 billion deal spree to transform into a major player in alternative assets, is integrating complex private investments into its ready-made portfolios for individuals.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺互惠互利的关税。它们是什么？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将 4 月 2 日称为 "解放日"，届时他将释放 "大招"，他似乎有意用互惠关税工具箱重塑美国的主要贸易伙伴关系。【原文：Describing April 2 as “Liberation Day” when he’ll unleash “the big one,” President Donald Trump seems intent on reshaping the US’s major trading partnerships with a toolbox of reciprocal tariffs.】

item.title: ENN Energy 以每股 24.50 港元的价格获得私有化要约
item.description: 在香港上市的中国天然气分销公司 ENN Energy Holdings Ltd. 收到了母公司另一部门的私有化要约。【原文：ENN Energy Holdings Ltd., a Chinese gas distribution company listed in Hong Kong, received an offer to go private from another unit of its parent company.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚寻求重新控制非法棕榈种植园
item.description: 印尼计划接管 100 多万公顷被称为非法棕榈油种植园的土地，这是印尼为净化棕榈油行业在全球市场的形象和增加国家收入所做努力的一部分。【原文：Indonesia plans to take over more than a million hectares of what it describes as illegal palm oil plantations, part of efforts to clean up the industry’s image in global markets and boost state revenue.】

item.title: 贸易战焦虑正在消耗美国股市的流动性
item.description: 市场数据截至美国东部时间上午 06:18。根据供应商协议，市场数据可能会有所延迟。【原文：Market data as of 06:18 am EST. Market data may be delayed depending on provider agreements.】

item.title: 日本央行新任董事避免在下一次加息时间上纠缠不清
item.description: 日本央行新任命的董事会成员小田顺子（Junko Koeda）在开始为期五年的任期之际，尽力就央行下一次加息的时机保持各种开放的选择。【原文：Bank of Japan’s newly appointed board member Junko Koeda did her best to keep various options open over the timing of the central bank’s next interest rate hike, as she started her five-year term.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利、摩根大通排除土耳其 4 月降息的可能性
item.description: 在土耳其金融市场经历了动荡的一周之后，该国刚刚开始的降息周期可能会被搁置。【原文：Turkey’s nascent rate-cutting cycle may be placed on hold after a tumultuous week in the country’s financial markets.】

item.title: 印尼中央银行称，尽管印尼盾下滑，但 "远离 "1998年危机
item.description: 本周印尼盾汇率跌至1998年亚洲金融危机以来最弱，当时印尼需要国际救助。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank defended the nation’s economic fundamentals as solid after the rupiah this week fell to the weakest since the Asian financial crisis in 1998, when the country needed an international bailout.】

item.title: 中国人寿利润跃升，股票上涨提高回报率
item.description: 中国人寿保险股份有限公司（China Life Insurance Co.【原文：China Life Insurance Co. said profit jumped 109% last year as a rally in the nation’s stock market bolstered investment returns and its premiums income expanded.】

item.title: 黄金库存飙升表明美国贸易再次出现巨大缺口
item.description: 大量金条从海外运入纽约存放处，可能会使美国的货物贸易逆差接近创纪录水平。【原文：The rush of gold bullion deliveries into New York depositories from overseas will likely keep the US goods-trade deficit close to a record.】

item.title: 半数美国家庭拥有 97.5% 的国民财富
item.description: 根据美联储的最新数据，截至 2024 年底，最富有的一半美国家庭拥有约 97.5% 的国民财富，而最贫穷的一半家庭只拥有 2.5%。【原文：The richest half of American families owned about 97.5% of national wealth as of the end of 2024, while the bottom half held 2.5%, according to the latest numbers from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 特朗普关注其他地区，习近平试探美国在印太地区的盟友
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将注意力转移到其他地方之际，习近平主席正通过在敏感问题上试探美国盟友，使整个印度洋-太平洋地区更加感受到中国的存在。【原文：President Xi Jinping is making China’s presence more felt across the Indo-Pacific region by testing US allies on sensitive issues, as Donald Trump’s attention is taken up elsewhere.】

item.title: 瑞典央行会议记录显示决策者未受通胀飙升影响
item.description: 瑞典央行官员上周就近期通胀率飙升的暂时性达成一致，同时还强调需要保持警惕，尽管他们认为近期不会有任何利率变动。【原文：Riksbank officials last week agreed on the temporary nature of a recent surge in inflation while also stressing the need for vigilance even as they see no interest-rate moves on the horizon.】

item.title: 中国银行因信贷减值减少而实现利润增长
item.description: 中国银行股份有限公司公布全年利润增长 2.6%，原因是减值减少有助于抵消利率下降带来的压力。【原文：Bank of China Ltd. reported a 2.6% increase in full-year profit as a drop in impairments helped offset pressure from falling interest rates.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧加剧，美国股市流动性趋于枯竭
item.description: 对全球贸易战经济影响的担忧进一步削弱了美股的流动性，令机构投资者头疼不已，这也可能加剧大盘的波动。【原文：Worries over the economic effects of the global trade war are further sapping liquidity in US stocks, creating a headache for institutional investors that could also boost volatility in broader markets.】

item.title: 德国最高法院批准征收 750 亿欧元团结附加税
item.description: 德国政府赢得了一项至关重要的法庭裁决，该裁决可能会从国库中剥夺多达 750 亿欧元（810 亿美元）的税收收入。【原文：Germany’s government won a crucial court ruling in a case that could have stripped as much as €75 billion ($81 billion) of tax income from the public coffers.】

item.title: 交易商转而押注利率维持不变，挪威克朗波动率大幅上升
item.description: 在交易商降低了对本周降息的预期后，挪威克朗的波动对冲成本跃升至11月以来的最高水平。【原文：The cost of hedging volatility in the Norwegian krone jumped to the highest level since November after traders pared back expectations for an interest-rate cut this week.】

item.title: 更高效的冷却系统可使印度免受夏季停电之苦
item.description: 美国加州大学伯克利分校的一项研究表明，更高效的空调可能有助于防止印度每年在炎热季节出现的停电现象。【原文：More efficient air-conditioners may help prevent the power cuts that every year overwhelm India during the hot season, according to a study by University of California, Berkeley.】

item.title: 当美国经济数据不可信时怎么办？
item.description:
随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）解雇独立监管机构并取消咨询委员会，世界最大经济体的数据可能成为下一个目标。【原文：

With Donald Trump firing independent regulators and killing off advisory committees, data on the world’s largest economy may be next.

】
